description:
I manage inventory operations across 120 retail stores and 3 warehouses, and we’re struggling with stockouts during promotions while excess inventory builds up on slower-moving items.
Using our data on sales trends, real-time inventory levels, supplier lead times, and past pricing strategies, how can I decide how much to reorder, where to allocate stock, and when to adjust prices each week?
Supplier deliveries are unreliable and lead times fluctuate, so I need decisions that account for uncertainty and warehouse capacity limits.
My goal is to reduce stockouts on high-demand products, minimize holding and markdown costs, and avoid costly emergency shipments.
How can I build an AI-driven system that makes coordinated forecasting, replenishment, allocation, and pricing decisions to keep the right products available at the right time at the lowest total cost?

StockLevels.definition: Current stock for each product at each store

SupplierLeadTimes.definition: Lead time required to fulfil orders from suppliers in days

StockoutFrequencies.definition: Frequency of stockouts for each product

ReorderPoints.definition: Stock levels at which orders should be placed for each product

WarehouseCapacity.definition: Capacity of each warehouse to hold inventory

OrderFulfillmentTimes.definition: Time taken to fulfill orders in days

objective.description: "The goal is to reduce stockouts on high-demand products, minimize holding and markdown costs, and avoid costly emergency shipments."

constraints.description: Current stock levels at each store must not fall below zero
constraints.formulation: $\forall i, j, StockLevels[i, j] + ReorderQuantities[i, j] \geq 0$

constraints.description: Total inventory across all stores and warehouses must not exceed warehouse capacity
Reorder quantities for each product must be non-negative
Stock levels at which orders should be placed for each product must not exceed available stock levels
Order fulfillment times must be accounted for in inventory decisions based on supplier lead times
constraints.formulation: $\\forall p, s: ReorderQuantities[p, s] \\leq StockLevels[p, s] + WarehouseInventory[p] - StockoutFrequencies[p] \\cdot OrderFulfillmentTimes[p] - SupplierLeadTimes[p]$

constraints.description: The frequency of stockouts must be minimized while considering reorder points
The total holding costs must be minimized within the limits of warehouse capacity
Emergency shipments must be avoided unless stock levels drop below a certain threshold

ReorderQuantities.definition: The quantity to reorder for each product at each store

WarehouseInventory.definition: The inventory of each product across all warehouses

StockoutFrequencies.definition: The frequency of stockouts for each product at each store

EmergencyShipmentsAllowed.definition: Indicator of whether emergency shipments are allowed for each product at each store
